column4: I need some help figuring out why my ubuntu box suddenly wont connect to a shared folder on my network
no its a samba share on a debian box
the only computer that refuses to connect to it is ubuntu
wired and wireless clients all over the house
the debian box hosting the share is wired though
why not? because im not going to set up a whole new share and filesystem JUST because ubuntu doesn't want to play nice. macs and windows and other debian boxes connect just fine
So, does anyone have ideas on how to troubleshoot this?
if i smbclient -L Host i get (Error NT_STATUS_HOST_UNREACHABLE)
can't get to that host, network/firewall/service not running
what?
NT_STATUS_HOST_UNREACHABLE it can't talk to that service over the network for some reason
ok - so work on the comms between the two hosts
checking the comms between the two hosts
sure, do some tests to make sure the two hosts can see each other on the required ports, telnet is a good test to hit ports
what tests have you done so far ?
it does, ufw - however what have you done to test this as I suggested
telnet to the port, see if a connection is made, or an error mesage comes back (send nonsense to it)
ahhh, dns
what does the samba log on the debian box say
that's cups - not samba
you're interest in something to do with your client connecting,
there is the central samba log, and the individual client log on the debian box, both ip and hostname referenced
